item.description:
DONK! - the Samurai Duck, the computer game, was created by THE HIDDEN and released in 1993 on the Amiga / Amiga CD32 games console. In this 20th anniversary commemorative card game, Donk has to tackle 7 Zones in his arch enemy Eider Down's world (Con-Struct, Electro Moss, Hab, Hanic, Plasma, Rock, and Subaqua), seeking the Gems that unlock the Zones, destroy Eider Down's Fortress, and defeat Eider Down himself!

Each Zone is represented by a separate deck of cards. To complete a Zone, Donk must work his way through the deck, turning over cards which could be Enemies to defeat (by spending Spin Power or using Power Ups), Hazards to avoid (by using Power Ups), various Devices such as the Map (to reveal the next few cards and jump ahead), Teleport (to jump to another Zone), Blocks and Switches that can hinder or help progress. Ultimately, Donk needs to find the Gem card within the Zone deck that unlocks the Zone, and then get to the Exit card to complete the Zone.

Each time a Zone is completed, Donk will get a chance to attack the Fortress / Eider Down by spending what Spin Power they have left if it is enough. If all Zones are completed, and Donk has enough Spin Power left, they could get the chance to defeat Eider Down in the Final Battle!

Donk! can be played in 1 player mode, as a solitaire card game, or in 2 player mode where Donk and his fighting partner Judo Juggs team up (sharing Power Ups) / or go head to head to complete Zones and defeat Eider Down.

This board game has been published together with two other polish games "Korporacja and "Kariera Polityczna" in a series of games illustrated by famous cartoonist Andrzej Mleczko. All three titles are lightweight party games with simple mechanics accompanied by amusing cartoons.

In Gierki MaÅ‚Å¼eÅ„skie, which roughly translates to "Marriage Games" players play in pairs (1-4 couples) and solve multiple challenges presented on cards. There are four types of cards: 

 Guessing what a partner would do in a given situation (i.e. who knows their partner the best)
 Charades
 Describing a given word without using a few other specified words
 General knowledge questions




It is possible to play with multiple couples (up to four) - in such case couples compete with each other. There is also a one couple variant in which partners compete against each other.

item.description:
In DragonHeist, 2 to 4 players are gold thieves, taking it in turns to plunder the sleeping dragon's hoard, pushing their luck to grab the most treasure, whilst trying not to wake the dragon!
Once all the coins from the hoard have been stolen, the player with the most treasure wins!

TREASURES!
Players roll 6 'Plunder Dice' to see what treasures they can collect - coins, keys, chests, or magic rings. If they finish their turn with any of these treasures they can claim them from the dragon's hoard. There are 3 magic rings to find that can protect players from dragonfire, silence their noise, or make them invisible!

THE DRAGON FIGHTS BACK!
Some dice rolled affect treasures – the dragon can snatch them back, or they can be made too hot to hold by dragonfire. The dragon's tail or wing send coins flying around his lair, whilst rolling a dragon's eye means the dragon is starting to wake up, so best not roll any noise!

DEFEATING THE DRAGON!
If a player manages to collect all 3 magic rings, and they are brave enough, they can try to defeat the dragon! With all 3 magic rings, they cannot be seen or heard, and are protected from dragonfire! The 'Dragon Die' is rolled to see whether the player can defeat the dragon before all their gold is stolen back

In this ultimate battle card game, powerful SOURCE wizards face each other in a spell casting show down! Two to four players move around the play area, made up of hidden Spell Cards, collecting and combining sets of cards to make powerful spells to unleash on the other wizards! The aim of SOURCES is simply to defeat your opponents - the last wizard standing wins!

Spell Cards come in four types, representing the power Source for each wizard – Fire (red), Earth (green), Water (blue) and Air (yellow). In each of these four Sources there are seven spell types (Molten Rock, Fist of Air, Acid Spray, Cone of Cold, The Orb, Sound Wave and Concussion Bolt). Combining these together in sets of one Source, or one spell type (eg. Molten Rock), creates spells that cause damage. Even more powerful spells can be made by combining specific sets of spell types in one Source colour.

Players start with 20 Life (indicated by a d20), a hand of four Spell Cards, and the play area is laid as a 4 X 4 grid of Spell Cards that start face down, with the remainder of the Spell Cards set aside as a draw pile.

Each turn, players can perform a number of different actions once each:
- Take a Spell Card from the draw pile if they have a hand of fewer than four
- Move their wizard avatar from one Spell Card in the play area to another adjacent card

 Reveal the Spell Card their avatar is on, choosing whether to trade this with one in their hand or not (either way a Spell Card has to be replaced back in the play area)
 Attack another player by discarding a set of three Spell Cards. There are three types of attacks:




1- Source attacks - three Spell Cards from the same Source colour, this type of attack only does 2 damage
2- Basic spell attack - three Spell Cards of the same spell type (eg. Molten Rock) from any of the four Source colours, doing the damage indicated by the spell type (1 to 7 damage)
3- Advanced spell attacks - each Spell Card has a combination attack written on it, consisting of three different spell types (all in the same Source colour). These attacks are the hardest to collect, and do the most damage (8 to 12 damage).

In Schnapp den Sack, Zacki the sack awaits in the middle of the table. Shuffle the deck of sack cards, which contains four types of sacks with 1-5 sacks on each card, then distribute the cards evenly among all players.

On a turn, flip the top card of your stack, then place it in the proper row of cards leading away from Zacki, with each type of sack getting its own row. If placing this card would make the sum of sacks in the row equal six, the first player to grab Zacki takes these cards; if the card would make the row go over six, then it's placed in a different row; if the player grabs the sack by mistake, they must place one card that they previously collected under their deck.

Once all the cards have been played and claimed by players, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins!

In Boinnnggg, each player is rolling dice to move their four plastic discs around the board onto either frog or flower spaces. When a flower space is reached, a player attempts to flick the disc onto a central flower-themed tower. Landing a piece on the top level or middle level will earn points, while landing directly under the flower will earn no points.

Play continues until the first player has landed all four of their discs onto or under the tower, with the winner being the player who scored the highest number of points.

From the back of the box:
"Frogs hop around this quiet pond, until one all of a sudden attempts to jump to the big central flower. Try to get all your frogs onto the flower in the middle but watch out, the first to get there does not necessarily win the game!"

Brainbox: Kaatje is a version of Brainbox specifically made for the Belgian/Dutch market. Kaatje is a popular television figure for small children. As with all Brainbox games the players are shown a card with a drawning and have to memorize all aspects as later they will be asked a specific question about it.

Scoundrel is a single player rogue-like card game for use with a standard deck of playing cards. It was developed by Zack Gage and Kurt Bieg for Train Jam 2011.

All Jokers, red face cards, and red aces are removed from the deck. The remaining cards serve as monsters (spades and clubs), weapons (diamonds), and health potions (hearts) valued from 2-14 (Two through Ace). The rooms of the dungeon are created by laying out cards in groups of four. Progress is made through the dungeon by playing three of the four dungeon cards. The fourth card serves as the foundation for a new room. Rooms can be reset in their entirety as many times as needed but never twice in a row.

Weapons may be equipped to attack multiple monsters in descending order of their value with damage being dealt to the player for monster values in excess of the equipped weapon. The weapon breaks if it is used to attack a monster of equal or greater value than the previous monster. Attacking a monster without an equipped weapon depletes the players health for the full attack value of the monster. Health potions may be used to increase life points up to the maximum starting value of 20. Playing a second potion in succession nullifies the effect of the second potion.

The game ends when life points reach zero or the player has progressed through the entire dungeon.

item.description:
Dark Ring is a card game designed for 4-8 people. Simple to learn, highly strategic, little luck involved.

Players act as Dark Ringers and needs to do their best to collect Energy Orbs each round. Each player would be assigned a secret role at the beginning of the game (either Innovator, Protector or Hunter). There are a total of 120 Play cards in this game. Each Play card would have 2 functions. The first is to use it as an action, and the second is to use it for scoring. Players need to choose a player to be the first Host. Every player needs to give one card faced down to the Host. The Host player would then decide which cards to give back to each player, faced down again. These cards would then become Trace cards to be used for scoring. In a clockwise order, starting from the Host player, everyone would have 2 chances to perform different actions by using Play cards from their hand. Play cards can either investigate or alter the Trace cards on the field. After 2 Action rounds, players need to decide to either take or give up their Trace card. Since there are positive and negative Scores, players should make their decisions wisely. The next player would then become the new Host and starts a new round. The game ends when any player collects 10 or more Orbs. Everyone then needs to reveal their Role and determine which team is the winner.

Based on the Cartoon character Wickie the viking

Wickie and the Vikings are on their way home on their drakar with a valuable treasure, when suddenly, Terrible Sven starts chasing them. The boat from Halvar and Wickie is much slower, so they have to hide in the fjords, a dangerous mission, but luckily Wickie has some maps from the fjords. Aid Wickie and his crew to find his way through the fjords back home.

In this two-player dexterity game, one player is Wickie who gives instructions, the other one is the boatsman who blows the ship over the waves through the fjords.
The carton box has a plastic inlay which has to be filled with water and has a little boats and dangerous riffs.

If you succeed to cooperate and get your ship into the safe harbour, you gain distance on terrible Sven, otherwise he comes closer

name.value: That Was The Year That Was

item.description:
Take a trip down memory lane in this game of fads and fashions.

Players alternate taking turns answering questions spanning the 50s thru the 80s covering fads/fashion, people, music, and television/movies.

A player is asked a question from one of the categories. If they are correct they will advance one space and be asked a question from the category depicted on that space. A player may answer up to 4 questions correctly and then their turns ends. If they answer a question incorrectly, their turn is over immediately.

The first player (or team) to reach 'finish' wins!

Delve into the enchanted woods of Sugi, meet the spirits dwelling there, and guide your predilect descendants so that they are the first to make it to the Temple.

In Sugi, players represent the spirit ancestors trying to guide their descendants through the forest so they find the Temple. Each player has a family tree indicating which are their favorite descendants and win points if they arrive in the right order. In turn order, players must play one of their cards in hand in one of these two ways:


 Adding the card to the movement line face down. When there are five movement cards, they are revealed and the movements resolve.
 Discarding the card to use its special ability. (Rotate a card or tile, draw cards, discard from the movement line...)


The author, Víctor Samitier (aka Kiru) is a member of the Spanish association of board game designers Ludo, coming from an artistic background in the fields of music and cinema. In 2015 he won the express board game design contest "crearxcrearxcrear" in the Granollers fair “JugarxJugar”.

item.description:
NASCARD Racing Simulator is a motorsport racing card game for 1-9 players.

The game is intented to be played with 1/64 diecast cars but you can play with the cards only.

The game system is simple but sophisticated, cars follow each other in line (1 car by space, on 1 to 3 lines dependings race and tracks), 
simultaneously all the players reveal 1 Speed card, and Action cards.
From the last player’s car, we are going to look by comparing speeds and position on the track if a car can overtake or decrease the gap with the car which precedes it, and so on, up to the lead car.

Every player possesses potentially the same Speed cards as his opponents, but does not know what are going to make for every turn, cars forward and behind him.
Cars not allocated to a player are managed by the system.
The races are governed by the same rules as those applied in reality.

Qualifying, launched start, restart, 4 tires pitstop, 2 tires pitstop, splash, tires wear inside and outside, save fuel, incidents, accidents, penalties, yellow flag, safety car, lapped cars, lucky dog, out of gas, green-white-checker finish, competition caution, all the tracks from the championship with their own properties, special superspeedway rules, everything is simulated with simple rules easy to implement.

This is a free game, you just have to pay the printing of the cards by a US printing company who send them directly at your home.

I realize this game because, 
1/ I am a great NASCAR fan, I have seen all the races since 1998.
2/ I played many years in some leagues to NASCAR RACING 2003 but this is different.
3/ I possess more than 200 1/64 diecast cars and no game give me opportunity to use and play with them.
For the first time they go out their boxes for a complete season scheduled.

So if you are a NASCAR fan, this game is for you.

Package Contents
608 cards: 
64 cards Chrono / PitStop 
22 cards Car-Hazard 
22 cards Car 
52 cards Track (permit to design the 23 tracks).
24 cards Incident on risk-taking
1 card pace car

For each of the 9 colours: 
16 cards: Speed
1 card: Risk-taking / Save fuel
1 card: PitStop 
1 card: Short run / Long run adjustment
28 cards: Tires / Fuel

Dubai is a fast set-collection game of speedy economy, tall towers, and savvy investments for 2 to 6 Architect Investors building and trading their way to be the wealthiest tower builder in the booming city of Dubai!

There is a board where each colour's value is tracked, as well as a 5-card face-up Market.

Each turn, players will either Take or Trade from the Market, Build a set of same-colour cards into a tower, which gains points but erodes that colour's value, or Invest in a colour by playing the colour cards in front of themselves, which increases that colour's value, and fights for share ownership of that colour. At the end of each phase, when towers are open for business, players with the most investments in the most represented colours are awarded ownership of the tower, and gains it for points.

A tower is considered complete if it has three different colours, and an existing colour can't be built into a tower.

The game is over after three phases, with one, two and three towers' completion to end each phase.

News Event cards appear from the deck that change up the game, but they don't resolve as surprises from the deck, but rather stay in the Coming Up pile until the next one is drawn, possibly giving time to prepare for the coming event. Or not! News is a fickle beast!


The full Print & Play & discussions can be found here:
https://boardgamegeek.com/article/21108398

The card game The Rangers Combat Card Game is a fast fun two player card game of strategy and math. The Rangers Combat Card Game features original artwork based on The Rangers film.

From the anvil of The Forge Studios comes The Rangers Combat Card Game, a game of high adventure.

In this first edition limited set, two armies go head to head in a winner take all battle of legendary proportions.

The Forces of Light–Spearheaded by the Rangers and their Wood Elf allies–take on the Forces of Darkness; the Orcs and their Shadow Elf masters.

The basic set includes 54 cards and a rules sheet, all in a handsome box.
The factions are divided into two decks of 27 cards each, with distinctive backs. The face of every card is different, with artwork inspired by the epic film The Rangers: A Shadow Rising.

The Rangers Combat Card Game is easy to learn but takes strategy to master. Gameplay is fast, fun, and exciting.

The battle begins with each player drawing five cards from their decks. The Forces of Darkness strike first in the initial Combat Engagement by playing a Character Card upon the field of battle. The Forces of Light then respond, each player takes turns playing Character, Specialty, and Specialty: Gear cards from their hand until one side or the other chooses to Call the Combat Engagement or they have played all the cards from their hands.

At the end of the Combat Engagement, each player tallies his Attack Modifiers. The player with the highest number of points wins the Combat Engagement. The victor takes the difference in points and removes that number of enemy cards from play.

Each Combat Engagement is a battle but one battle does not win the war!

Each player then draws back up to five cards. The loser of the last Combat Engagement now gets to go first.

WIN the game and the war by removing five enemy characters from play!

THE RANGERS COMBAT CARD GAME!

item.description:
The third Pondus boardgame in Norwegian, based on Norways most popular comic book Pondus. This is as the two other games, a trivia party game with question cards. The mechanics is slight different compared to the other two games. 990 new questions in 5 categories.

First dude around Pondus pub bar wins the game.

Published by Egmont/Litor.

Here's the norwegian text from the game box:
--

Pondus brettspill. Fotballspillere fra ulike obskure oldboys-lag og byens flotteste damer har funnet veien til Pondus Pub.
 For de som har evnen til å legge sammen to og to øl, blir dette en hektisk aften. Det er nettopp der du kommer inn i bildet, for øl skal serveres, spørsmål skal besvares og bardisken skal erobres. Målet er nemlig å flytte raskest en hel runde rundt bardisken.
 Belønningen for riktig svar er opptil tre flytt framover, og med de fem kategoribrikkene du har foran deg, kan du lettere fordele oppgavene slik du selv vil. Du kan satse alt på å flytte lengst og raskest, eller spille rolig og trygt, og håpe at du ikke møter deg selv i døra i neste runde. Til slutt kan sjansekortene snu opp/ned på alt når du minst aner det. Her hjelper det lite å ha en stødig serveringsarm og aldri søle en øl. Førstemann rundt bardisken vinner spillet og får straks tilbud om fast kveldsjobb i Pondus Pub. Inneholder 990 spørsmål i 5 emner.
 Spillet er på norsk

item.description:
Discover a new way to play a trivia game!

You don't need to have great knowledge to score points; just be smart.
Each player has question cards in his hand.

Your turn:

 Choose one of your questions.
 Choose who will respond and how you ask your question.
 Predict what the result will be (success or failure, for example).




If the chosen players or respond as you expected: you earn points.

400 questions, 6 ways to score points: no need to be a sage to win!

From back of box:

Easy to pick up... impossible to put down!

 Race to get rid of all your cards.
 Match colors or numbers.
 Use the action cards or house rule cards against your opponents.
 When you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO!"




These 4 extra cards are game changers!
Play the "Swap Hands" card to change hands with any opponent!
3 Customizable cards let you write any house rule you want!
Customizable cards erase to make new rules.

item.description:
Card game with a ball-sport theme.

At the beginning of the game, each player holds a hand of 5 cards and other cards cards put face down on the tables.
Three discard piles along with a 'referee' card are placed at the centre of the tables.

The cards feature a ball (i.e. football, rugby, volleyball or basketball) of one of four colours. The back of the card gives a clue on the face side, e.g. colours, shape...
 The object of the game is to get rid of one's cards by playing them if the card colour doesn't mach the discard piles.

If a card matches both shape and colour, it bounces (hence the name) to another player's pile.

item.description:
In Cafundó you must battle against creatures from Brazilian folklore. Get your apparels and try battle saci, curupira and others.

You chose your adventurer and start with some gold. You get your 5 first gear cards. This will help you battle against the odd creatures who lives behind the bushes.

With your gear in hands, the first player will roll the dice to define if is morning or evening. This will affect some cards and give a bonus.

The player who steals the most gold from the creatures wins the game.

In the world’s favorite cities in this Here & Now version of the fast-trading property game, Monopoly! The jet-set gameplay will be epic as you race around the world to visit the world’s most exciting places and buy locations. Every time you add another stamp to your passport, you get closer to the globetrotting win!

Travel around the gameboard visiting The World's most exciting places.
Pay for the stamps of the places you land on and put them in your passport.
Charge other players vistor fees to stop at places you have stamps for.
The first player to fill their passport wins!

Different than traditional Monopoly (even previous "Here & Now" Editions) - there are no houses, hotels, or even title deeds. The goal isn't to bankrupt other players (in fact, the rules say if you are out of money, just don't pay - but keep playing). The goal of each player is to fill their own "Passport".

This game plays far more like Monopoly Empire than Monopoly.
Another edition with places in the US is Monopoly: Here & Now (Buzzfeed edition).

Not to be confused with Monopoly: Here and Now â€“ The World Edition.

In Vivarium, you assume the role of 1 of 8 species seeking to start a new life within a new, unpredictable environment.

Initially you are equipped only with your species inherent capabilities and the instincts and fears you brought into the vivarium. By exploring this new environment, accruing Energy and utilizing your abilities you can acquire new behaviors, reproduce, claim territory and complete objectives in order to increase your Fitness.

Vivarium is played over 4 years and each year contains 4 distinct seasons for your species to thrive or struggle in, at the end of the 4 years, the player with the most Fitness Points has demonstrated that their species is most suited for survival in this new environment and is declared the winner.

Vivarium is a dynamic game that explores the nature of 8 species through mechanics drawn from natural phenomenon, immerse yourself in the world of Vivarium and see if you have what it takes to ensure your species endures into the future.

Each copy of Vivarium currently includes:
192 cards
170 tokens
19 double sided map tiles
8 unique player boards
1 initiative token
1 season dial
1 Fitness track
10 zip bags
1 rule book

name.value: The Elf on the Shelf Naughty or Nice Board Game

item.description: The Elf marker is placed in one of six locations on the board based on a card draw. Players spin to determine how far they can move (0-6 spaces) their pawns and the first player to reach the Elf's location gains a token worth 1-3 points. A new location is drawn for the Elf and the cycle is repeated six more times. The player with the highest point total after the Elf has been reached at the final location wins the game.

The Way to Heaven is based on "The Pilgrim's Progress" the development of games. Player is fleeing from the City of Destruction, to the Heaven's Gate. The journey is called "The Way to Heaven". This road will be marked on the game board. In each location, the player must fulfill certain conditions to be able to move forward to the Gate of Heaven.

Each player has six cards and use. Card has three attributes given set camp, resources and ability.
1.Camp: Saints or Sinners
2.Resources: Faith or Hope or Love
3.Abilityï¼š Camp ability or General ability

Players must select the camp, collect resources, the ability to use. Camp can be converted for use camp ability. Help them get the victory, or stop other players advance.

No certain strategy, allowing the player to choose the camp. For sinners also possible to obtain victory. Everything depends on interaction between players and choice.

Drive fast, grab the garbage and bring it to the landfill!

Wasty & Furious is a quick-to-learn card game for 2 or 3 players. Your goal is to collect as much garbage as you can and bring it to the landfill.
But pay attention! Your opponents want to grab the prize too and will do anything they can to stop you from reaching your intent.

The Gameplay
During set-up each player selects a vehicle data sheet and gets a number of Waste Collect cards depending on its stats (this cards will be visible to all players).

Each player is then given a number of cards depending on the vehicle own Capacity.

During a game turn, a player can take some actions:


 play a number of Garbage or Event cards, up to his vehicle Speed
 as soon as he plays an Event card, his turn ends and the cards rules are applied to the following opponent
 instead of playing an Event, he may choose to use a Waste Collect card, that will allow him to collect the garbage on play and refresh his own hand


When a player picks up the last card from the deck, the game is going to end. Every player will play a single turn and then all hands will be discarded.

Everyone will then sum up victory points collected during play to see who's the Garbage Man of The Week.

The world struggles in the Cold War, and many see the sky as the next battlefield. The era of Space Race has just begun. Do you have what it takes to lead a daring space agency into a new age of human achievement?

Space Race takes place during the first seven decades of the space conquest, and players become directors of newly established Space Agencies. Their goal is to expand them and to achieve astonishing breakthroughs. During the game, players will develop their Space Agencies by acquiring various cards (engineers, technologies, space programs) from a shared pool of cards called Universe.

Space Race is a card game based on finding synergies and constructing powerful combinations out of different abilities. There is no guaranteed winning strategy: players have to respond to an ever changing environment in order to identify the best course of development while competing with their opponents for the most interesting discoveries.

The game is played in seven rounds. In every round, players acquire new cards into their agencies and activate abilities on cards they already own. In order to do this, players spend one of the limited set of Control Cards during every round. The player who creates the most developed Space Agency, builds the most impressive Laboratory and reaches the most remarkable breakthroughs wins the Space Race.

Space Race uses a simultaneous action selection mechanism at the beginning of every round, when players choose one of their remaining Control Cards that will determine which abilities players can use during the round. Every Control Card activates one of four possible stripes on cards and players can only use those abilities that are on the active stripe. As there are only 3 Control Cards of each of the 4 types and no Control Card can be used more than once, players have to combine different types of cards and abilities to be successful during the 7 rounds of the game.

item.description:
Wolfed is a card game, based on the famous (game) Mafia, also known as Werewolf. The rules are simple. The game is divided into days and nights. The werewolves kill a member of the village each night. During the day the remaining villagers need to find out who are the werewolves and lynch them, before they are all killed. The werewolves are considered winners once their number equals the number of the remaining survivors.

Wolfed is both simple and amusing game. It is an awesome way to break the ice especially for parties, team buildings, or just a way to have fun with your friends or complete strangers. It is an amazing social experience. Each game is unique on its own as there are near infinite number of combinations that you can play.

Wolfed has unique art-style. Each character in the game has its own design. There are no 2 cards that look alike. There are also event cards which bring twists and turns in each game. And of course at the end we added a pinch of new roles you have never seen before. They have been thoroughly tested to make sure that the balance remains unchanged. 
The rules have been improved and written from scratch to make sure they are easily understandable.

item.description:
Description from the publisher:

The sky’s the limit in Apples to Apples Freestyle game! Branching out from classic Apples to Apples game play, Apples to Apples Freestyle introduces a whole new kind of creative fun – players get to make up their own hilarious answers!

Each round, a different player is the "judge" and turns over a card to reveal a fill-in-the-blank statement.

Everyone else comes up with a word or phrase to fill in that blank and writes it down on their personal apple slate – and what they choose to write can be as crazy as they want it to be!

The judge selects the best answer and decides the winner of that round.

First player to win 4 rounds wins the game! Offering customization, creativity, and constant laughter, Apples to Apples Freestyle game is perfect for the whole family!

Includes 216 cards, 5 writing slates, 5 wet-erase markers and instructions. Colors and decorations may vary.

The survivors of a long-ago invasion have taken refuge in the forgotten underground city of Gravehold. There, the desperate remnants of society have learned that the energy of the very breaches the beings use to attack them can be repurposed through various gems, transforming the malign energies within into beneficial spells and weapons to aid their last line of defense: the breach mages.

Aeon's End is a cooperative game that explores the deckbuilding genre with a number of innovative mechanisms, including a variable turn order system that simulates the chaos of an attack, and deck management rules that require careful planning with every discarded card. Players will struggle to defend Gravehold from The Nameless and their hordes using unique abilities, powerful spells, and, most importantly of all, their collective wits.

item.description:
This game was made in cooperation between the Dutch Justice Department and Identity Games. It represents the chain (the Dutch word "keten" means "chain") of organizations and how the inter operate with each other to get criminals convicted.

Naturally, it is a simplification of reality. It only has the main portion of the process to show the general working.

The game was published in order to help the general public understand the working of the Dutch Justice Department better.

Apart from a custom playing board, there 55 "strategy" cards and fifty-five "question and answer" cards, a custom six-sided die and twenty pawns.

The pawns are in four colors, one for each player. Each color has five symbols, representing the five "chains" in the game, namely (1) civil law, (2) juvenile law, (3) criminal law, (4) administrative law and (5) immigration law.

The fifty-five "strategy" cards are similar to "Chance" cards in the Monopoly game, the are "events", things that happen either in favor of the current player or in favor of other players.

The fifty-five "question and answer" cards are use in a Trivial Pursuit style. Every throw the player is asked a question on one of the cards. If the answer is correct he / she may move the pawn (according to the number on the die) and choose to throw again. If the answer is incorrect, he or she ends his / her turn.

The single six-sided die has only three possibilities. There are three sides with a single dot, two sides with two dots and one side with a capital "S" on it. If the player throws either a single dot or two dots, he / she has to answer a question. When the player throws the "S", he or she gets to draw a "strategy" card.

The main target of the game is to educate people about the working of the Dutch Justice Department. The way to win the game, is to have your five pawns move along their respective paths and complete them first.

The foul forces of Darkmoor have amassed their legions to strike at the Capital City. Despite their well-laid machinations, something awaits them within the city walls: the realm's legendary heroes, who have gathered to council the king. Failing to siege the city, each overlord's minions must now retreat to Darkmoor lest they be captured—or worse.

In Retreat to Darkmoor, 2-4 players assume the roles of dark overlords of the realm, each commanding an identical deck of minions. Your goal: to successfully evade the legendary heroes and take refuge in the various locations of Darkmoor. Each minion that manages to escape will count toward control of a location, but beware of your so-called collaborators, as each overlord also scores points for eliminating rival minions!

item.description:
It's in Indian version of a famous counting game. There are 14 slots, 7 slots per player. Middle slot is to count your score for each player. The rest of the 12 slots have 12 beads each to begin with. You start by taking beads from one slot and move in a clockwise direction, putting one bead in one slot, till you run out of beads. If you end up in an empty slot, you score that bead + the beads in the slot opposite that.

You cannot take beads out of your scoring slot.

Elements is a quick playing, resource collecting, alchemy game with plenty of "take that" action!

During the game, each crafter attempts to construct a variety of substances using eight distinct elements, each one a building block of a particular substance. Four primary elements — Water, Earth, Fire and Air — start the foundation of a substance, and four secondary elements — Oil, Wood, Metal and Power — bring the substance to life.

Substances require 3-5 elements before they are complete. The harder to complete, the more points you earn. Complete a substance naturally (without the use of the ninth wild-card element, Meta) and earn bonus gems that can be used to complete other substances. Earn the most points, and you win!

What actions you take each turn depend on your dice roll. Roll doubles and earn a bonus effect! The dice add an element of luck while managing your cards and gems adds an element of strategy.

A "Snappy" action game, where in the goal is to be the first player to score 300 points (or unless a time limit is set and reached) by launching the shooting rod from the rubber bands, attempting to get past the player "manning the trap" trying to prevent you from scoring. Any number of players can participate.

Released by Schaper Manufacturing Co, 1973 but also says The Cootie Company on the box as well.

"It doesn't matter how it happened... All that matters is that it did happen. It was simply bound to after all. I remember hearing the stories as a kid about the day the sky turned red. They called it sunfall, because it looked like the sun fell from the sky... But some of us are still here, doing our best to press on. Spending most days just trying to put food in our mouths... Trying to make the best of this hell on earth. It wouldn't be quite so bad, if not for those damned raiders. Scumbags come in and try to take what isn't theirs. Well next time they come I have a little surprise for them... hehehehe..."

Siege of Sunfall (SoS) is a game for 2-6 players in which each player attempts to protect their own settlement in a post apocalyptic world. However, they also must work together against a common enemy, the Raiders! The key is to send the right amount of troops out to protect the region, while also keeping a few at home to developed their skills for future rounds.

SoS uses simultaneous play and an average game takes about 45 minutes or less to play. Blind bidding, bluffing, press-your-luck, and some worker placement are the foundation for the mechanics.

Winner of the Gamer's Remorse Killer Game Design Challenge!

Components

54 Raider Cards
88 Troop Meeples
57 Resource Tokens
3 radiation Tokens
2 Kaboom! Tokens
6 Player Mats
6 Player Screens
Booklet
Two-Piece Setup Box

Commander Chess, or Cá» tÆ° lá»‡nh (literally "Chess Command") is a xiangqi variant created by Háº£i Quý Nguyá»…n.

Cá» tÆ° lá»‡nh is played with 38 pieces (19 per player) on a board that is 11 lines wide and 12 lines long. As in xiangqi, it is played on the vertices of the grid. The board is divided into two lang territories by a river in the middle of the board. The three files on one side of the board form the sea. The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Commander, or all units of a single division of the opponent's army.

The pieces on both sides, with their abbreviations, movements, and rules, are:


 1 Commander (C): moves any distance orthogonally; captures 1 point orthogonally; may occupy Headquarters; may not "see" the opposing Commander on an open file
 2 Infantry (In): 1 point orthogonally
 2 Tanks (T): 2 points orthogonally; may capture on sea squares it cannot enter, remaining stationary; carries C, In, or M
 1 Militia (M): 1 point orthogonally
 2 Engineer (E): 1 point orthogonally; carries all pieces, only across river; controls airspace 1 point any direction
 2 Artillery (A): 1–3 points any direction; crosses river only at reefs, by attacking, or carried
 2 Anti-aircraft gun (Aa): 1 point orthogonally; may capture on sea squares it cannot enter; controls airspace 1 point any direction
 1 Missile battery (Ms): 1–2 points orthogonally or 1 point diagonally; controls airspace as it moves
 2 Air force (Af): 1–4 points any direction; may return to its departing point after capturing or carrying, unless capturing opposing Af; carries C, In, or M; destroyed immediately on passing through opposing airspace
 2 Navy (N): 1-4 points any direction on sea, sea banks, and river banks; captures as it moves at sea; shoots 1–3 in any direction at land targets; controls airspace 1 point any direction
 2 Headquarters (H): stationary and does not capture; may house only C; protects C, but not itself, from In, M, Aa, and Ms


General rules:

 Pieces capture as they move, and never jump, unless noted.
 Pieces can cross the river but not occupy sea points unless noted.
 Pieces which check the opposing Commander are promoted, gaining special abilities.




The Chinese xiangqi has generally been the most popular form of chess played in Vietnam. In fact, there is no traditional distinctively-Vietnamese chess game; which is partly what inspired Cá» tÆ° lá»‡nh.

Cá» tÆ° lá»‡nh is played on the vertices of an 11x12 "geographic" board similar to the 9x10 xiangqi board, with the addition of an ocean occupying files A–C and two "reefs" allowing all pieces to ford the river. It shares many features with wargames, including area denial, ranged attack, and unit cooperation.

Besides the fact that Vietnam has never had a distinctive regional form of chess, Nguyá»…n noted four complaints with xiangqi influenced the creation of Cá» tÆ° lá»‡nh:

1. Xiangqi promotes individualism and class conflict, particularly in the willingness of players to sacrifice low-level pieces to succeed.
2. Winning xiangqi is due more to luck than to intellect.
3. Xiangqi does not reflect the geography and history of Vietnam.
4. Xiangqi has many rule variantions, none of which are accepted by the entire community.

Each of these points is answered in Cá» tÆ° lá»‡nh:

1. Pieces cooperate through a "carrying" and area denial mechanics. As well, losing an entire class of piece loses the game, forcing protection of and cooperation among all classes.
2. Nguyá»…n believes the interactions between pieces and influence of geography necessitate more strategy and reduce the role of luck.
3. Besides the single river of xiangqi, there is an ocean, as well as "reefs" across the river, all of which interact with special piece rules. Besides the Vietnam-like geography, the pieces modern rather than ancient military structure.
4. By promoting Cá» tÆ° lá»‡nh educational programs, Nguyá»…n hopes to ensure that a single authoritative set of rules is used by all players.

Fognik is a small but powerfully enchanted land. The Four Towers of Fognik are home to the highest level of enlightenment that a mortal can achieve. However, over the last age the Four Towers were mysteriously abandoned and Fognik left in disarray.

You and a small group of other demigods have come to rule Fognik and restore the Four Towers to its rightful place as a center of power. There can be only one ultimate ruler of this magical land.

Four clans of humans and a myriad of mysterious creatures inhabit Fognik.
You can claim your power by having followers and using your influence to enlighten worthy peasants.

Those that climb beyond the blue mountains shall be enlightened and will reside in one of the four towers.

Those that claim the fiery depths of the red gorge shall find themselves cast as demons in the underworld. The power of the underworld is strong and every new demon that turns to the depths of darkness also dims the light and casts a lord from the four towers into the depths.

Train some of the humans as mercenaries, merchants and mountaineers to help your cause. Sacrifice your followers in the champion’s temple to gain the will of powerful creatures that inhabit this strange and varied land.

If you can use all of the tools at your disposal you could rule this mystical place and control the Four Towers!

Four Towers is played on a concentric grid laid out on a map of the four clans domain. Each turn a player places one peasant from any of the four clans on the grid and places two other peasants as followers or as one of the three occupations; mercenaries, merchants or minstrels. The grid represents the power struggle for control. Peasants that make it to the outer circle of the grid become lords while those that gravitate towards the center go to the underworld and become demons.

Players collect followers as a means of supporting and predicting which clan will have the most lords. Mercenaries, merchants and minstrels each score influence points at the end of the game while also presenting additional capabilities.

Sixteen unique champion cards each with their own special skill and/or bonus point structure helps to make every game completely unique and presents an enormous number of paths to success.

Points are calculated by multiplying each clans followers by the number of lords, calculating the bonuses from the champion cards and collecting influence points from the different occupations. The player with the most points is victorious.

item.description:
In The Ants Go Marching, first released as BauBoom, players need to help ants construct an anthill by moving ants along the road to collect materials in order to complete their personal blueprint.

The road is on a shared game board that features colorful building tiles that players try to collect in their individual wheelbarrow. To do this, at the start of your turn you roll two dice, then move forward a distance equal to either of the dice or the sum of them. If you want the tile on which you land, you can place it in your wheelbarrow. The trick, however, is that you need to remember all of the tiles that you've already acquired because once you reach the end of the road you try to fill in your blueprint from bottom to top with those tiles; for each wrongly collected tile, you must discard one that's perfect for your plan. Whoever first manages to use the colored tiles to build their predetermined anthill wins.

The Ants Go Marching includes anthills of different levels to allow players of different skill levels to compete more evenly.

item.description:
Crafters, builders and carriers — your help is needed to dispel the mists of Nebula! The people of the valley will reward you handsomely if you harvest and exploit our many resources, open paths through the mists, and help our settlers build new structures. Cooperate temporarily with other builders in order to create paths and share goods, but do not forget your own objectives. Will you have a statue erected in your honor on the Nebula City plaza?

A game of Via Nebula starts with a board showing a hexagonal grid, some production sites with a few available resources on them (wood, stone, wheat, and pigs), building sites in various areas scattered over the whole board, and a lot of mist.

Turn after turn, players have two actions at their disposal from these options: They may clear the mist of a hex to create new paths of transportation, open new production sites, open a building site in a city, carry resources from any production site to their own building sites, and, of course, achieve a construction. Resources and paths through the mist may be used by all the players. This initially induces a kind of cooperation, but eventually other players will take advantage of your actions!

To achieve a construction, you fulfill a contract on one of your cards. You start the game with two contracts, and four more contracts are available for all players to see and use on a first come, first served basis — and that's where the cooperation abruptly stops. Additionally, most contracts have special powers that are triggered on completion.

The game ends when a player finishes a fifth building. Opponents each take two final actions, then players score based on the number of cleared hexes and opened production sites and the point value of their contracts, with a bonus for the player who ended the game.

item.description:
It's year 1978 and in Italy on promulgate the law 180, which ratify the closing down of all psychiatric hospitals. 
The idea of the game is to remember and relive the atmosphere of this important period...
Players identify themselves in a doctor releasing patients from their jails or in the severe guardians trying to repress this situation, moving the pieces on 8 different boards.
There's just one doctor to free all the patients, but the guardians can use their superior number to overwhelm him, so move carefully and try to reach the exit with planning and strategy. 
Each board, representing original layout of real mental hospitals and asylums, is enriched by pictures of the author's photography-project "Persistenze". 
Punto 180 is not just a game: it's a unique crossover and a way to let everybody know about a so important law, that had a worldwide impact and changed the life of many people.

Each turn players must move every active piece. 
The doctor move his white piece first, horizontally or vertically how many spaces as he likes. The patients (yellow pieces) start the game in their jails and the doctor must stop in an adjacent space to free them; once free, a patient moves the same way of the doctor and must exit the board reaching the yellow arrows. Every patient get out this way scores 1 point for the doctor's player. 
The guardians (black pieces) move again like the doctor, but can take the yellow pieces (the patients) moving on them. 
Each yellow pieces taken this way is removed from the board and scores 1 point for the guardians player. 
Important: a guardian can move on a patient only if black pieces has numerical superiority or tie on that line of the grid! Moreover, they can not overstep or jump the doctor white piece. 
The player with more points at the end of the game is the winner.

Game objective: Make your way through the board encountering terrifying Spooks along your Journey to defeat toughest of Spooks; the Dragon King!
Plot: You have begun a journey full of Spooks. There are seven Spooks waiting to Spook YOU! Can you make it out alive? You are about to embark on the most terrifying Spook Journey ever.
There are various spaces on the board that you'll encounter. Tombstone Spaces, Pit Space, Vine Spaces and Item Spaces. Players may share spaces only on Exit Spaces or Battle Spaces. If you land on another player’s pawn at the end of your turn, the player occupying the space moves back to the next available space on the board.

item.description:
Dueling tile game that's a cross between dominoes, consequences and certain pocket monster type franchises.

Build monsters from your hand of tiles and send them to destroy your opponent, crushing anything that is in the way. The first set contains three decks - bugs, bots and beasts that can normally only combine with themselves unless a "combine" card is used to cross the gene pools. Original Artwork from Tang Mu though templates are provided to go make your own sets and fight! Files are available for Print 'n' Play or laser cutting your own set.

With a starting hand of 7 tiles, players have 3 actions per turn, picking up, playing or attacking (can repeat the same action more than once to get to three) A monster can only be started with a head section and can only attack when it is completed with a tail. As many body tiles can be played in between these two providing that the symbols on the sides match (combine tiles come into play here). Each tile adds different features to the monster - a red dot/explosion means another d6 is added to the attack pool and a shield with a number in it is a hit point that can only be destroyed by an attack die with a number equal or higher than it. If all the hit points on a tile are destroyed then that tile is taken off the monster and put back into the bag. Players also have three hit points of their own health and are removed from the game when they are destroyed (they can choose which monster defends the attack or can take the damage themselves to keep their precious creations safe)

For extra silliness, when attacking the player has to shout the entire name of their monster (each tile has a portion on the side of it) leading to absurd and often hilarious monsters weighing into battle.

Greebles is published with a Creative Commons Attribution Non-commercial share alike licence as the creator is a great fan of collaboration. It was partly inspired by the drawing game consequences (or exquisite corpses if you went to art school :p) where a piece of paper is folded multiple times with a segment on a body drawn on each and then folded before passing to the next person so the final monster is only revealed when the paper is unfurled. There are blank templates available for the creation of your own sets and the author is planning on releasing official expansion packs as a way of showcasing other illustrators and ideas. A card game variant is also in the works.

Shallows is a 2-6 player card battle game using 42 custom Whailz with unique abilities in a free for all competitive fray that can be played again and again.

Shallows uses a unique 6 suite Attack/defense system that is very easy to learn but allows each player to be unique in both his strategy and combat style. Players can opt for a fully aggressive tactic or even defensive approach.

The game mechanics is a combination of War and Mag Blast, but with the decision making on the player's side, not the cards.

On top of that, this game is packed with parodies. From SNES games to 90's cartoons, animes to internet jokes.
To create a news story by drawing random words and fitting them together to make sense until the block is filled up, then a headline is chosen. The winner is the one who has added the most words.

name.value: Less game. Like Chess but Less!

item.description:
Less is a simple strategy board game for two or four players. It's a simple game which can be set up in seconds and the rules can be learned in less than a minute. Just take the nine board pieces, place the game pieces and you’re ready to go! The goal is to move your four pieces to the opponents starting corner before he moves them to yours.

The board is set up randomly at the beginning of every game and there are over 100,000 combinations to try out. Less can also quickly be expanded into a four-player game by adding another set of tiles to the deck. This way you have to work together with your partner to bring both of your pieces to the other side before the other pair of players does the same.

item.description:
Brain Freeze is a cool new kids strategy game of secret sweet treats that helps develop important mental skills through exciting back-and-forth game play! In Brain Freeze, two players or teams race to correctly guess the secret sweet treat that the other player or team has chosen. The kid-friendly symbols include Ice Cream Sandwich, Milkshake, Ice Cream Cone, Popsicle, and Snow Cone. Using only strategic thinking, deduction, memory and logic, players make guesses, record answers, and eliminate variables until they feel they can correctly guess the opponent's secret sweet treat. Guess right and Win, but guess wrong and...you got a Brain Freeze!

Brain Freeze is based on the award-winning gameplay of the Telepathy board game (Parent's Choice Foundation Recommended Seal and National Parenting Center Seal of Approval). Brain Freeze is an ideal game to introduce strategy, logic and deduction to younger kids in a fun manner they'll enjoy, making the process of learning important skills they'll benefit from in school and life a blast! And with a minimal amount of pieces required, Brain Freeze is fast to set-up, easy to learn, and always provides a fun mental challenge for hours and hours of play that never gets old.

On an archaeological expedition, you discover the ancient tome of riddles that you had long been searching for—sadly, its pages are torn to shreds beyond hope of reassembly. Your hopes dashed, you decide to raise your spirits by using the fragments of riddles that remain to hold a contest of wits and riddle-making with your friends at the local tavern…

As players lay down cards, a single riddle slowly gets more and more complicated. You must decide whether to add more to the riddle or to challenge someone to answer it.
You can choose some of the riddle’s clues, but don’t get caught without an answer!

RUMBLESLAM was designed to be a quick and fun game that you can play within an hour and has evolved into so much more. It is fast paced and all players are always active so no one gets bored waiting for their next go.

Battle one on one or team up with a friend to play against a pair of opponents. The more fighters in the ring the more action! Your team of wrestlers must try to eject the opponents team from the ring, something that gets much easier after a successful knockout!

Players will use dice rolls relevant to a stat on a wrestlers character profile card to try and knockout the opponents team, which will make ejecting them from the ring much easier.

item.description:
Archaeology: The New Expedition is a reimplementation of the popular Archaeology: The Card Game (with several changes).

You are an archaeologist working the dig sites of the Egyptian desert. Search for the right pieces to complete torn parchments, broken pots, and other priceless artifacts. Explore an ancient pyramid in the hope of uncovering a huge stash of treasure! Trade shrewdly at the local marketplace to increase the value of your collection. Sell your treasures to the museum at just the right time for maximum profit.

But beware, the desert also has its dangers! A devastating sandstorm can throw your expedition into disarray, and cunning thieves lurk around the dig site ready to steal your prize discovery!

In Archaeology: The New Expedition, you want to find treasures and make the most money possible by selling them to the museum. Players start with four treasure cards in hand; one monument tile is chosen at random, then the chambers of the monument are loaded secretly with treasure cards.

On a turn, a player digs for treasure by drawing from the deck. If they find treasure, they don't show anyone and keep it; if they find a thief, they steal a card at random from an opponent; and if they find a sandstorm, all players lose half of their cards in hand to the marketplace, which starts the game with five face-up cards. (Each player has a tent that they can discard to avoid the effects of one sandstorm.) After digging, a player can:


 Discard one or more maps to explore one chamber of the monument, looking at all the cards there and keeping some number of them.



 Trade at the marketplace by laying down one or more treasure cards and picking up cards with equal or lesser trading value.



 Sell to the museum by placing sets of treasure cards in front of them; in general, the more cards you have of a type, the more the set is worth.


Players can explore only once, but they can do the other actions repeatedly, and they can take these actions in any order. Once the deck is empty, players keep taking actions until they all pass in turn, after which they sell treasures to the museum. Whoever ends up with the most money wins!

According to the designer, Archaeology: The New Expedition differs from Archaeology: The Card Game through the inclusion of tent cards, the addition of new treasure types and additional cards to allow for five players, the adjustment of some treasure values, and the inclusion of six monuments instead of one to have more variety when exploring.

The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game

item.description:
The Walking Dead: All Out War is a tactical head-to-head game set in the walker-strewn Georgia countryside, a survival miniatures game from Mantic Games based on the characters from the pages of the bestselling The Walking Dead comic series. Your group will be pitted against other groups in a bitter fight for supplies, but the Walkers react to your every move. In this game, everyone and everything is trying to kill you.

In more detail, each player controls their own group of survivors made up of popular characters from The Walking Dead storyline, such as Rick, Shane, Michonne and many more. Each survivor is represented by a finely-detailed plastic miniature, which can be painted in your color scheme of choice. It comes with a character card highlighting their game stats and unique abilities, and it can be upgraded with a selection of weapon and equipment cards.

The game is set around Atlanta and the surrounding suburbs, and contains a gaming mat and a selection of barricades, abandoned cars and supplies to give it that authentic The Walking Dead atmosphere. Your survivors move across the board using the measuring stick included with the game, and you use the terrain to block Walker routes, sneak up on opposing survivors, or raid enemy camps for supplies.

During the game, you fight a bitter battle for resources against a rival group of survivors – but be careful not to make too much noise as you'll draw the attention of the Walkers, which are controlled by an AI system developed specifically for this game. They attack anyone who comes within reach — and because they are AI-controlled, you can play the game solo.

The base game includes rules for running simple campaigns and basic guidelines for designing your own characters.

item.description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Tiere ("Unuseful Knowledge: Animals") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts about animals.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! Can fish die from sunburn? How many naps does a bunny have per day? And do herrings really communicate by farting? The big questions of the animal kingdom - in this quiz from the popular section of the NEON magazine, they will all be answered"

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Können Fische an Sonnenbrand sterben? Wie viele Nickerchen macht ein Kaninchen pro Tag? Und kommunizieren Heringe wirklich durch Furzen? Die großen Fragen der Tierwelt – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zu Hause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

Each player gets a squirrel and the objective is then to collect nuts in each of the five colors.

You move around the game board by dice rolls and collect nuts by landing on the squares with the colored nuts on them. When you roll your die you must move the entire roll unless you can reach a nut with less.

A fox is also in play and blocks the road he is on. The fox is moved freely on the board (not following paths) by a player when he rolls a one - though not to squares containing nuts or other players.

Player also start with 2 random pine-cone cards giving advantages that can be used during the players turn (jumping over the fox, exchanging a nut of one color for another and such). You can get more cards in 2 ways - either by landing on a pine-cone square or by landing on a square that contain another squirrel. When landing on such a square each of the 2 players have to roll a die and the one with the largest roll gets the pine-cone card.

Possessão Arcana ("Arcane Possession ") is a board game for 1 - 6 players, a Dungeon Crawler. And before you go defeat the enemies, you must first decide if you are prepared. A wide variety of demons invade the earth plane, from goblins to supreme lords of the underworld. It is up to you and your mates face these demons together and send back to hell.

But the Arcane Magic is wild and you can be corrupted. Be careful.

In Possessão Arcana, players will struggle with the demons, with magic, they need to find three magical artifacts, but it is not easy, the character has a Possession Arcana level, go to the maximum, the magician must fight with others, but if all artifacts are found, players will face Lord demon.

While exploring the city, a player rolls dice to calculate his attacks and defenses. He keeps check of his life, mana level and Posession Arcana. The demons are controlled by Artificial Intelligence through the Command and Aura cards.

From the publisher:
Choose carefully or the enemy will strike! Strategy and suspense collide in this exciting escape game! Advance your Resistance heroes toward safety, but move fast-the Star Destroyer Finalizer is on your tail. The spinning starship of the dreaded First Order can aim in any direction, and you may be in the line of fire! Bounce the beam off the mirrored deflector shield toward your enemies, and evade the surprise laser blasts! It's fast-moving, family fun in a galaxy far, far away!


 Choose to play as Resistance or First Order
 Use the Deflector to block or redirect the laser
 For 2 to 4 players
 From the new film, Star Wars: The Force Awakens

quizzone is a trivia game containing 3.000 questions in 10 categories (Music, Movies & TV, Language & literature, History and religion, Sport and leisure, Art and culture, The world, Society and business, Out and about, Nature and science.

The board is two sided. On one side all 10 categories are in play and have a predefined color. On the other side you choose 6 categories to play with and define their color by placing a token on colored circles.

It is possible to play as individuals or teams - up to 8 in total.

Each player places their token on one of the squares at the rim of the circular board. There must be at least one free space between players.

When the game starts you get a question in the color that you are standing on - if you answer the question correctly you move one space closer to the centre. If you answer incorrectly nothing happens. The winner is the one that reaches the centre first and answers a question of a self chosen category correctly.

Each player receives 4 tactics cards at the start of the game and 2 extra every time you land on a shaded square (though only once in a ring of the board). Normally you can only move directly forward towards the centre but the tcatics cards change this. Some cards let you move a player token of your own chosing back or forward or sideways or even diagonally. Other cards let you answer other players cards, force other players to answer yours or let you choose the category of a question disregarding which color you are currently on. Finally there are cards that override other cards.

If you land on a square where another player already is standing he is sent 2 squares further away from the centre.

One Page 40k is a single-paged ruleset designed to be fast to learn and simple to play. It serves as a great introduction to the Warhammer 40.000 universe for people who are new to the game, and as a way to play quick games for veterans of the franchise.

item.description:
quizzone stories is a trivia game with 100 cards each containing 1 picture and 6 questions. The first question is based around the picture - the next is based on the answer to the first question and so on.

When the game ends can be freely decided and it is therefore a great game to bring on a road trip and the like... The winner is of course the one with the most correct answers.

To win the game, the players have to get each of their 5 meeples in one of the 5 game circles on the board. First the gamemaster rolls a die to determine the aktive circle, which is marked with the white meeple. If a player rolls the same number as the game master, he may place a meeple on any free space of the active circle. On a roll of a 6 the player may place a meele in any circle. The spaces 1 to 4 are safe. Only meeples on a 6-space may be replaced by an opponent meeple. The replaced meeples go to the training center at the bottom of the game board and the players have to perform an athletic task. The training center can only be left on the roll of a 6.

The game Ends, when all players have a meeple in each circle. The player with the highest point count wins the game.

Also included are a soccer game (Fußballspiel) and an athletics game (Leichtathletik).

Tattoo! The Game of Ink is a set-making card game of inked body art for 2-4 players where the positioning of the cards matters.

Play as tattoo enthusiasts seeking to have the most Reputation Points when the Design Deck runs out. Use Cash to buy, place, and score Tattoo Designs from the Flash Wall onto your individual Arm Board to gain Reputation Points, and chain similarly Themed designs or play on Prominent Locations for a bonus. You need these points to win the game, but you can also spend them to supplement your Cash and buy bigger and better ink. However, each Arm Board has limited space, so to keep scoring Reputation Points, you'll need to pay Cash to Laser off old designs and score new tattoos.

Tattoo! The Game of Ink features card art from 29 tattoo artists around the country, box and Arm Board art from Nolan Nasser, graphic design by Brian Patterson and Robert LeBlanc, and is being published by Gaming Paper LLC.

item.description:
A space program game but with a veeery low budget. You are entrusted with a task to explore space and expand a world of beerlings!You'll hire a team of "extremly talanted" beerlings build a spaceship from scra... from different parts and go in space and even found a colony and maybe if you are really luck... skillful discover alien life.

A game of space exploration and colony management for 2-4 players. At the beginning of the game players deside turn order by rolling dice, then build a space ship from different junk by buying ship tiles of different tiers from stack (cards) with their starting budget which is veeery limited, after this players generate their "heroic" crew by blind drawing trait tokens. After this every player decide the destination by choosing a planet, gas giant or asteroid on a map and try to fly their ship to the chosen destination to found a colony or space station and then manage it. During flight a lot of different events will happen (card drawing) and players will try to deal with them by moving astranaut tokens to the ship tile-event location and roll dice. The time of the program is limited by the total number of turns. And the goal of the game is to survive and make their space program successful by getting the highest amount of points at the end of the game (for every astronaut alive, every module standing and every token of resources) while every turn everything goes wron....to hell.

Talismanoj is a 2-player card game (with cards and rules in Esperanto) in which each player draws from their own deck and plays cards to create two sets of 3 cards (each set must share a common attribute but have different colors) and a legend card, while surviving attacks by the opponent which can remove their previously played cards. Combat is resolved by playing cards from one's battle reserve (where the cards must have been previously placed in anticipation).

The 2 player decks have different themes and art: one deck has a "Don Quixote" theme (with Gustave Doré art) and the other deck has various Esperanto authors ("Verdaj DonkiÄ¥otoj").

With multiple sets, it is possible to play with more than 2 players.

In a land where Heroes have battled monsters from time immemorial, a fragile peace has been forged. The fighting spirit, however, still remains. In a final effort to avoid rekindling the ages-old combat, a proposal was made: A tournament of Heroes and Monsters battling as days of old. The fame and glory of the fight without the risk of continued war. This tournament became an annual tradition, one which is now called Monsters in the Middle.

Monsters in the Middle is a light-weight modular card game. It features a base set of cards as well as modular cards, which are added to the game to change game play and interactions.

The game is suitable for family play, even those with younger children.

Players can choose to either play a single match from the given games or a tournament consisting of several games.

The games of Monster in the Middle are:

The Champions’ Duel - in this game, players take turns competing to complete sets of cards played on the monsters to earn points. The player with the highest point total when any player plays their final card is the winner.

The Grand Melee - in this game, players work at the same time, trying to be the first to play all their cards.

The Royal Chase - in this game, players work to match the cards in their hands to the cards needed to complete a given set, capturing the Monsters and scoring points along the way.

The Castle Paths - in this game, players draw a hand of cards and select which order they are to play them. All players reveal each card simultaneously, comparing the value with their opponents. The player with the highest total card value wins the cards. Play to capture your opponents' treasures and rid yourself of the monsters in your deck.

The Triumphant March - in this game, players compete to have the highest ranked hand of their opponents, wagering cards along the way to increase their chances of drawing the cards they need.

The various games of Monsters in the Middle include:
Set Collection
Take That
Hand Management
Simultaneous actions
Simultaneous play
Bluffing
Variable player powers
Grid movement
Card shedding
Note: Some games include player elimination, but in all cases where player elimination is possible, it is also an end-game condition.

item.description:
QuickFight is the world's first Legacy Deckbuilder.

In QuickFight, you'll not only be writing on cards to upgrade them, but you'll also be physically tearing cards apart. As you fight to create the strongest army, you'll make changes in game 1 that will affect all future games. And by the end of the campaign, you'll have a version of QuickFight that's unlike any other in existence and infinitely replayable. You can even take the deck you built in your game and play it against your friends!

The best part? You can learn and play a game in about 30 minutes. Perfect to pull out during a lunch-break.

It's time to make money. Lots of money.

As CEO of a rapidly growing company, it's your job to aggressively grow your company by any means necessary. Perhaps those failing companies around the block might have some extra employees and business opportunities that they don't know what to do with.

Oh, and make sure to lay everyone off by the end of Q4. We need to save money where we can, you know.

Based on the QuickFight: A Legacy Game engine, Corporate Raiders is a lunchbreak deckbuilder that can be learned and played in just 30 minutes, and features simultaneous play so and your fellow CEOs can get a game in quickly, before your real boss catches you!

From the publisher:

A global-level World War II game from Compass Games from the Charles S. Roberts Award-winning design team of Ben Madison and Wes Erni. Absolute Victory features three large maps (39x26 hexes each) covering the entire world on a sliding scale that gives more attention to places of the world (such as Europe) that saw the most fighting, and less to places (such as South America) that didn't.

1,700 counters represent the armed forces -- land, naval, and air -- of more than 90 nations. A chit draw system of more than 2,500 random events plunges the players into the chaotic world of the wartime 1940s, a world of competing agendas, unstable nations and untrustworthy allies.

Game mechanics are designed to focus the player's attention on military and strategic aspects of the war rather than the "boring stuff". They include simple production rules (no bean counting), a tense land combat system featuring battle modes, and turns built around alternating pulses -- some military, some political -- that minimize 'down time' for the non-phasing player.

The Splendor: AsmOPlay Kit (Organized Play Kit) contains translucent versions of the gem tokens, gold-colored versions of the gold tokens, 4 new noble tiles with original artwork and bonus combinations not featured in the original game, as well as playmats that offer a structured play area.

The kit includes 2 Splendor demo games; 2 custom playmats (Splendor: Play mat); 4 special gem token sets of each color (Splendor: Translucent Gem Tokens); 2 gold token sets (Splendor: AsmOPlay Gold Tokens); 16 sheets of new noble tiles (Splendor: Nobles Promo Tiles); 2 event posters; 1 instruction sheet; 2 sign-up sheets templates.

Relive the entire Cold War in ten minutes with Twilight Squabble!

In 1947, the superpowers of the United States of America and the Soviet Union began a new sort of conflict, a struggle in the twilight of World War II. This war centered on the increasing development of nuclear weapons, and as the years passed it seemed like the war would never end — but no one wants to play a card game for decades. Thus, this game presents an abridged version of the Cold War — less of a twilight struggle and more of a twilight squabble...

item.description:
The first player to reach the space "Ziel" wins the game. Movement is determined by playing (very tiny) cards. Some spaces hinder or benefit the players.

The players start with 3 cards. To move the player must match his cards to the number on the space ahead of his playing piece. If he does this with one card (the number on the space and the card are the same), he moves one space. If he uses more cards (adding and/or subtracting) he moves according to the number of cards he uses. After each move the player draws a new card and moves again if possible. If he can't match the number, he can't move and the next player draws a card and continues the game. On the first turn the players may only draw a fouth card, if the can't match the "1" on the first space with their three cards.

The playing pieces are little plastic disks with a hole in the center and are moved with wooden sticks.

Manege frei für Felix is a cooperative children's game in which the players, as circus artists, look for the rabbit Felix and try to get it back to the circus tent before Director Barelli lets the show start without him. The game design uses a simple dice-rolling mechanisms as well as seven face-down cards that might be reshuffled during the game.

Telepathy: Magic Minds is a spell-binding new abstract strategy game based on the award-winning head-to-head gameplay of the original Telepathy, now updated with mystical and magical symbols.

In Telepathy: Magic Minds, two players (or teams) race head-to-head to see who can be the first to correctly guess the opponent's secret square using only strategic thinking, deduction, logic and a sharp memory. Secret squares are defined by four variables: symbol, color, row, and column.

Like Battleship meets Sudoku, after selecting and writing down the secret square on the Secrecy Shield, players then take turns making strategic guesses, recording the responses and eliminating variables until they feel confident they can correctly guess the secret square and win! The Secrecy Shields enhance the game play by providing a real focal point for your Telepathic powers so you can really try to concentrate to see if you can get that supernatural psychic advantage!

item.description:
Fur vs Scale is a fast-paced tabletop card game for 2-4 players, pitting anthropomorphic animal heroes of rival kingdoms against each other in strategic combat. The game captures the ebb and flow of an arcade fighter, challenging players to construct winning combinations of attacks, blocks, counters, super moves, and special abilities over four rounds of combat to reach 60 points and be crowned victor.

Players begin by selecting a hero, each with unique special abilities and a pool of Move List cards. At the start of each round, both players construct their Move List of six cards from their hero's limited pool. Play then alternates as each player adds one of their cards to the table, creating a Fight Map of varying point values. Special abilities, combinations, and power ups may also be used to alter the Fight Map or achieve bonus points.

Once all Move List cards have been played, scores are tallied for the round. If a player has accumulated 60 or more points, they are are declared the winner. Otherwise, players construct a new Move List and begin another round. If neither player has accumulated 60 points after four rounds, the game ends in a draw.
